content: I was trying to formalize a slide from a presentation and I came to the concept of "A (multivariable) polynomial over an R-module". Mathlib says that mv_polynomials are defined over rings. I guess you could define a polynomial over an R-module and evaluate it for values of R, though you just wouldn't be able to multiply such polynomials. Would it be reasonable to change the definition of mv_polynomial to allow this?
You can also take polynomials over the tensor algebra of your module.
This is referring to polynomials that evaluate as u + x • v + x^2 • w + ...?
try using the tensor product of the mv_polynomial over the ring with the module?
